text: hello everyone in this video let's take
a look at the native support of
passwordless authentication on Amazon
Cognito which was introduced in November
2024 first let's take a quick look at
what is Amazon Cognito it is an identity
management service providing
authentication authorization and user
management for your web and mobile
applications enables seamless sign up
sign in and secure access to your
applications it also supports
integration with identity providers like
Google Facebook Facebook apple and
Enterprise systems like saml and open ID
connect it offers fine grained secure
access control by integrating with AWS
identity and access management roles so
with this new launch AWS is now
extending the native support for
passwordless authentication to the
applications you build using Amazon
Cognito so this new feature makes your
login process simplified by providing a
more secure and frictionless experience
for your users
it supports different signin options
such as pass Keys email OTP and SMS OTP
reducing the burden on users to remember
different passwords also one of the
common issues in this digital world is
either reusing the same password at
multiple sites or using insecure
passwords which is the common basis for
different security attacks such as
credential stuffing and password
spraying this new passwordless
authentication protects against those
attacks so there are are three different
types of passwordless authentication
options supported today the first one is
pasy they are based on Fido standards
and use public key cryptography in
combination with Biometrics like Touch
ID on Apple MacBooks and windows hello
facial recognition on PCS to verify
users identity unlike passwords pass
keys are unique to each person and
device which makes them more secure and
also increases protection against
attacks such as fishing and account
takeovers
other options are email and SMS OTP
where your users can sign up to your
application and can confirm their users
accounts with email or SMS message otps
and can automatically sign in with the
passwordless factor that matches with
their confirmation message so this way
Cognito provides flexible authentication
options depending on your user needs and
preferences talking about the
availability this feature is available
globally except aw's gocloud region and
also supported in cognito newly released
managed login interface and also an
amplify SDK it is offered as part of the
Cognito essential TI and above let's
take a quick look at the demo so I am in
the AWS console and in Amazon Cognito
service page for this demo I have
already created an App client to choose
the passwordless authentication for this
application let's get into the
authentication sign in in option and
here under options for Choice based
signin you can see passwordless status
is currently inactive so let's click on
edit and choose the additional choices
available there are three options Pass
Key email OTP and SMS message for this
demo I'm going to choose pasy and email
message along with the traditional
password so I'm going to keep the
configuration for pasy and email as
default and click on Save
so let's take a quick look at how an
user login page will look like so let's
click on the app client and view login
page I'm going to sign in as an user
user
one and here you can see it is asking
user one to sign in with a pass key
let's try another way so here along with
Pas key it is also showing the user to
choose the signin method either through
email or the traditional password so
using this passwordless feature you can
provide an option for your user to sign
in to your application as they prefer if
you are interested in knowing more about
the passwordless feature please check
out Amazon Cognito developer guide and
AWS blog on Amazon Cognito new feature
updates thank you for watching
